docs.title: ChatGPT Docs
docs.text: Welcome to ChatGPT Docs.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: git clone https://github.com/obiscr/ChatGPT.git

docs.title: Development tools
docs.text:
Install Gradle

Refer here to install Gradle.

Install IntelliJ IDEA

Download IntelliJ IDEA (Ultimate Edition) from JetBrains Website, The recommended version >= 2022.1.

docs.title: Configure Gradle JVM
docs.text:
First open the ChatGPT project in IDEA. If there is no problem with the Gradle configuration, after the project is opened, Gradle will automatically download the required dependencies.

After the Gradle task finishes running, we open File - Settings, Select Build, Execution, Development - Build Tools - Gradle

Need to set Gradle JVM

Select the combobox to check if there is corretto-17, if so, just select it.

If not, select Download JDK..., then

  • Version：Select 17
  • Vendor：Select Amazon Corretto 17.x.x
  • Location: Location customization

After waiting for the download to complete, the value of Gradle JVM is selected as the Corretto JDK just downloaded. Finally, save the settings.

docs.title: Build the plugin
docs.text:
First open the Gradle window in the tool window on the far right of the IDE, and then click 按钮 to refresh the project.

Wait for the sync to complete, select Tasks - intellij - buildPlugin

At this point, the plug-in package starts. After the package is completed, you can find the packaged files under the build/distributions directory of the project.

docs.title: Install the Plugin
docs.text: Open File > Settings/Preferences > Plugins > ⚙️ > Install plugin from disk... Select the packaged file just now to install it.

docs.title: How to Debug
docs.text:
In the run configuration of the menu bar, select Run Plugin, then click the Debug button to start another built-in IDE, which has built-in our plug-in, You can debug with breakpoints.

Note

Note that if there is no Run Plugin, Then first open the Gradle window in the tool window on the far right of the IDE, Click Tasks - intellij - runIde. Run it first, and then you can find the Run Plugin in the running configuration.

docs.title: Useful Links
docs.text:
Success

If you encounter some difficult problems, you can also seek help in the following channels.

  • Youtrack
  • JetBrains Platform Slack
  • IntelliJ Platform SDK
  • IDEs Support (IntelliJ Platform) | JetBrains

docs.title: Donate/Sponsor
docs.text:
Open source projects are not easy to maintain. If possible, I also hope to support the author a lot. The author is now sacrificing rest, exercise, and free time after get off work to maintain this project with all his strength.

  • PayPal: https://paypal.me/obiscr

  • Buy me a coffee: https://buymeacoffee.com/obiscr

Alipay

WeChat Pay

docs.title: 1. How to join the Slack?
docs.text:
Answer

Click Join Slack to Join the Slack.

docs.title: 2. Is the plugin free to use?
docs.text:
Answer

The plugin itself is free, but if you use the official source, you must have a Chat GPT account, which may require payment.

docs.title: 3. ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect?
docs.text:
Answer

This situation indicates that you cannot access the official server of Open AI and may need a proxy.

You can use the following method to test. Use the curl tool to access directly, please remember to replace the following API Key with your own:

curl https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions -H "Authorization: Bearer <Your API Key>" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{ "model": "gpt-3.5-turbo", "messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "Hello!"}] }'

docs.title: 4. Plugins are not available in Android Studio?
docs.text:
Answer

Thanks for @LiLittleCat

The solution is from https://github.com/LiLittleCat/intellij-chatgpt/issues/3#issuecomment-1354157517. Thanks to @LiLittleCat

Step1: Check the ide.browser.jcef.enabled

First open Android Studio and open any project. Double click ⇧ Shift and search: Registry

Make sure ide.browser.jcef.enabled is checked.

Step2

Open the menu Help > Find Action，Search Choose Boot Java Runtime for the IDE

Select Runtime

Select a Runtime that includes JCEF，click OK to download automatically

Restart Android Studio after the download is complete

As you can see, you can use it normally now.

If the automatic download fails，can be downloaded here: https://github.com/JetBrains/JetBrainsRuntime/releases

Then select Add Custom Runtime... Add

Click Add JDK... Select the file you just downloaded

If there is any problem with the runtime，click Use Default Runtime to reset.

docs.title: 5. Why can't I search for this plugin in the plugin market?
docs.text:
Answer

Currently the plugin supports versions from 2020.1 to 2023.1.(Support EAP platform). If your IDE version is less than 2020.1, it cannot be searched. There is no way to use either. Please consider updating your IDE version to 2020.1 or later.

docs.title: 6. How to deal with problems?
docs.text:
Answer

When you have a problem, you can

  • Ask for help in Slack
  • Create an issue on GitHub
  • Send email to author

Note

Note, either way, please provide more information when describing the problem. Such as pictures, videos, etc.

docs.title: Important: At present, Open AI officially does not support Google/Microsoft account login, not because the plugin does not support it
docs.text:
ChatGPT is a language model trained by OpenAI and can be used for a variety of tasks, including dialogue and text generation. ChatGPT is a neural network-based model that is trained on large amounts of human language data and is able to generate natural language text that is meaningful in a given context. The model can be used for many applications, such as natural language processing (NLP) and dialogue systems.

This project is a plugin that supports ChatGPT running on JetBrains series IDE.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
There are three installation methods, choose any of the following methods to install.

  • Quick Install
  • Install using the built-in plugin system
  • Manual installation
Quick InstallBuilt-in plugin systemManual installation

Settings/Preferences > Plugins > Marketplace > Search "ChatGPT" > Install Plugin

Download latest version and install manually: Settings/Preferences > Plugins > ⚙️ > Install plugin from disk...

After the installation is complete, in the lower left corner of the IDE window, move the mouse to this icon, all tool windows of the current project will be displayed.

Then select Chat GPT, you can see the Chat GPT window. Or find Chat GPT directly in the tool window on the right side of the IDE to open it.

docs.title: Set up below
docs.text:
Note

Note that the setting part is very important, please be sure to read it carefully.

docs.title: Supported Versions
docs.text:
2020.1 ~ 2023.*(Support EAP platform)

About 2023.* EAP Version

If you can't find it in the plug-in market, please go here to download the latest version: https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20603-chatgpt/versions/eap, then install it.

docs.title: ChatGPT
docs.text:
Important

Note that the currently officially open API is GPT-3.5-Turbo, where ChatGPT uses a third-party proxy server. Therefore, it may be unstable, and there is a certain limit on the number of requests per hour. Please see here for details: https://github.com/acheong08/ChatGPT/blob/main/README.md

Please don't give me a bad review if it doesn't work. I will try my best to let everyone use better services.

docs.title: Official Source
docs.text:
Enter email and password, and click the Login button. After the login is successful, the Access Token will be automatically filled (this may fail, try a few more times.)

Note

Microsoft and Google account are not supported.

The expiration time of the Token is displayed below the Access Token. When the IDE starts, it will check the expiration time, and if it is less than 7 days before the expiration time, it will be automatically refreshed.

docs.title: Customize Source
docs.text: If you have your own server, configure it here. The returned parameters need to be consistent with the official ones. Otherwise, parsing errors may occur.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
If you want to use ChatGPT, you need to configure OpenAI - ChatGPT related settings, see the ChatGPT Settings。

If you want to use GPT-3.5-Turbo, you need to configure OpenAI - GPT 3.5 Turbo related settings, see the GPT 3.5 Turbo Settings。

After the configuration is complete, you can enter any content in the text area, click the Enter or send button, and the question will start. If the text generation takes a long time, you can also click Stop to stop the current content generation.

When we want to end the current chat and start a new chat again, we can click New Chat in the upper right corner to create a new chat.

• Online ChatGPT is now back

  • GPT 3.5 Turbo is available

  • How to get api key

  • How to join to Slack

docs.title: GPT 3.5 Turbo is available
docs.text: On March 2nd, OpenAI released the API, Currently the plugin has access to the new API.

docs.title: How to get api key
docs.text: Due to the limitation of OpenAI's official server, the ChatGPT model cannot be used temporarily. So the plugin accesses the GPT3 model. It's a relatively old model and not very smart. But it can be used normally.

docs.title: Get Api Key
docs.text:
First, you need to register an Open AI account,(Note: This is required). Then open website, Log in first. After the login is completed, it is still at the previous website

Click Create new secret key, The secret key shown in the figure below will be generated, click the copy button on the right.

docs.title: Configured in the plugin
docs.text:
Paste the copied content to the location of the official source API Key set by IDE ChatGPT. Save it and use it.

At this point, the configuration has been completed and it can be used normally.

docs.title: How to join to slack
docs.text:
Slack

Click here to Join the Slack.

docs.title: Online ChatGPT is now back
docs.text: Online ChatGPT is now back with enhanced features.

docs.title: Support the built-in actions
docs.text:
Now the selected text can be answered directly in Online ChatGPT.

Step1: Select a code

Step2: Right mouse button, select optimize code

Step3: Then you can see the answer of Online ChatGPT

docs.title: UI Actions
docs.text: And it also supports refreshing the page, clearing cookies, zooming in/out the webpage.

docs.title: 新增
docs.text:
• 可以停止对话任务
  • 可以复制对话文本
  • 支持代理设置
  • 支持官方的 GPT 3.5 Turbo 模型

docs.title: 修改
docs.text: • UI 重新设计

docs.title: 移除
docs.text:
• 暂时移除浏览器模式
  • 移除默认源
  • 移除 Cloudflare 源

docs.title: Changed
docs.text: • Fix some bugs.

About the garbled code issue with GPT 3.5 Turbo's Streaming Return turned on.

I have tried multiple devices in my environment and tested several times, and have never been able to reproduce this issue. So this change is a speculation of what could go wrong based on previous experience.

Note: This is an attempted fix, if you still have problems with the update to version 2.1.10, please let me know at this announcement by clicking ↑. Or you can comment below.
Fix an issue that icon color is displayed incorrectly when New UI is enabled in IDE.

Fix the bug that the reply message content is empty in some machines.

This is a bug worth $18

I need a buddy to help me with this problem, I have tried many ways and never been able to reproduce it, I may need to debug my project on your machine. Find out what the problem is. If the problem is solved successfully. I will send you a brand new Open AI account with $18 credit.

Prerequisite: Your machine must be able to reproduce the above issue consistently, if it is occasional, I'm afraid I don't have time to wait for the issue to appear randomly.

Thank you very much!
Support custom server address for GPT 3.5 Turbo.
Support to Save System Role.
Modified the way Access Token is obtained (via browser)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Open https://chat.openai.com/chat and login

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: After login, open https://chat.openai.com/api/auth/session

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Copy all the contents (or just the accessToken value) to the text box in the settings screen and click the Save the Access Token button. The value of the Access Token will be saved automatically. Finally, click OK to close the settings.

docs.title: Added
docs.text: In ChatGPT tab and GPT-3.5-Turbo tab, the text box will get focus automatically after pressing F key. Eliminates the need to click with the mouse.

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • Support custom display order of Content in tool windows

docs.title: Changed
docs.text: • UI description information optimization

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • Support for adding custom prefixes

docs.title: Support conversation model change
docs.text: Model selection for ChatGPT and GPT-3.5-Turbo is now supported.

docs.title: ChatGPT
docs.text:
For ChatGPT a total of two models are supported.

  • text-davinci-002-render-sha: （Default Model）
  • text-davinci-002-render-paid: For PLUS users, this model is available.

docs.title: GPT-3.5-Turbo
docs.text:
For GPT 3.5 Turbo, five models are supported.

  • gpt-3.5-turbo （Default Model）
  • gpt-3.5-turbo-0301
  • text-davinci-003
  • text-davinci-002
  • code-davinci-002

You can choose the corresponding model according to your needs.

docs.title: Support for GPT-3.5-Turbo Context
docs.text:
Note

This feature is off by default, to use it, please enable contextual support by checking the box here.

More Tokens will be consumed when context support is enabled.

docs.title: System roles supporting GPT-3.5-Turbo
docs.text:
Before asking a question, you can enter a brief description here, specifying the role of the assistant.

With contextual support enabled, if no customization is entered, the default is: You are a useful language assistant.

docs.title: Support to check the usage amount of the account
docs.text:
Version 2.1.4 has been updated with the OpenAI Little Assistant, which allows you to query the usage of an account directly inside the IDE.

Prerequisites

You must first provide an API Key in order to query it.

For example, if you want to query the usage of account A, you have to provide an API Key of account A first, and then you can query the usage of account A.

After you enter it, click the Refresh button on the right side to check it. (Please make sure your network can access OpenAI's server properly)

If no API Key is entered here, the API Key configured in GPT 3.5 Turbo will be read by default.

The API Key provided is for whichever account will be queried for usage.

docs.title: Support to Create API Key
docs.text:
Similarly, the OpenAI Assistant also supports the creation of an API Key.

Prerequisites

As with the query usage above, you still need to provide an API Key first.

After entering it, click the Create API Key button on the right side to create it. (Please make sure your network can access OpenAI's server properly)

If no API Key is entered here, the API Key configured in GPT-3.5-Turbo will be read by default.

An API Key will be created for whichever account the provided API Key belongs to.

Note

Currently an account can only create 5 API Keys, if you already have 5, creating them again will prompt an error.

Once created, click Save it above and it will save to the GPT 3.5 Turbo configuration. That is, it will be saved here.

docs.title: Remove unused built-in prefix
docs.text:
• Add a test case
  • Explain

Of course, you can add to the list of custom prefixes for those who need them.

docs.title: Fix the ChatGPT Network error
docs.text:
Note

Maybe this is temporary, because I'm not sure, when it will become unavailable again.

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text:
• Fix #107
  • Fix the problem of GPT 3.5 Turbo displaying blank
  • Fix the UI flicker problem

docs.title: Support GPT-4 Model (Only for ChatGPT Content)
docs.text:
Note

The current Open AI restriction, the gpt-4 model, is only valid for Plus users. Non-Plus users should not use this model for now.

Open Files - Settings/Preference, select Tools - OpenAI - ChatGPT, in model settings, select gpt-4 to use it.

docs.title: Add help button
docs.text:
A new help button has been added to open documents or announcements here (others may be added in the future).

Note

Because there is an official review mechanism, which prevents me from updating in real time. So for some announcements type messages. I will add them in Announcements. Please stay tuned.

docs.title: Changed the display of OpenAI assistant
Support GPT 3.5 Turbo to display the number of Tokens consumed per conversation
docs.text:
First, please go to the GPT 3.5 Turbo setting of the plugin and Enable token consumption

When enabled, the following is displayed.

You can see that after enabling it, the Token consumed by this conversation is shown at the end of the returned message.

  • Prompt tokens: Token consumed for this prompt text
  • Completion tokens: Token consumed for this completion text
  • Total tokens: Total Tokens consumed for this conversation

docs.title: Supports GPT-3.5-Turbo streaming response
docs.text:
Note

Token usage is disabled when streaming response is enabled, and these two features cannot be active at the same time.

Open Files - Settings/Preference, select Tools - OpenAI - GPT 3.5 Turbo, in model settings, check Enable stream response to use it.

docs.title: Support Proxy Authentication
docs.text: Open Files - Settings/Preference, select Tools - OpenAI, in the proxy settings, check Proxy authentication and enter the proxy account password.

docs.title: Support gp4-xxx series model
docs.text:
Note

GPT-4 is currently in a limited beta and only accessible to those who have been granted access. Please join the waitlist to get access when capacity is available.

About more info, please see https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/gpt-4

docs.title: Server Settings
docs.text:
Important

Note that the current official open API is GPT-3.5-Turbo, where ChatGPT uses a third-party proxy server. So it may be unstable and there is a limit to the number of requests per hour. For more details, please see here: https://github.com/acheong08/ChatGPT/blob/main/README.md

Please don't give me a bad review if it doesn't work. I can't guarantee the stability of the third party server, I will try to make everyone use a better service.

docs.title: Unofficial (unstable)
docs.text:
The account and password here will only be used when getting the Access Token, it is only stored locally on your computer and will not be uploaded to any server for storage.

Enter your email and password, then click the "Login" button. The Access Token will be automatically filled after a successful login (this may fail, try a few more times.)

Note

OpenAI officially does not support Microsoft and Google account login. It's not that the plugin doesn't support it.

The expiration time of the Token is displayed below the Access Token. The IDE will check the expiration time when it starts, and will automatically refresh if it is less than 7 days before the expiration time.

docs.title: Customize
docs.text: If you have your own server, please configure it here. The returned parameters need to be the same as the official ones. Otherwise, parsing errors may occur.

docs.title: Conversation Model
docs.text:
For ChatGPT a total of two models are supported.

  • text-davinci-002-render-sha: （Default Model）
  • text-davinci-002-render-paid: For PLUS users, this model is available.

docs.title: Add Prefix
docs.text:
Here you can add your own custom directives. Click on the menu bar.

A blank line will be added. After the prefix input is completed, the mouse leaves the line area. It will be added successfully.

docs.title: Edit Prefix
docs.text: If you want to modify it, use the mouse to select and double-click to modify it.

docs.title: Remove Prefix
docs.text: Finally, if the input is wrong, or you don’t want to use this prefix. You can click on the menu bar to remove it.

docs.title: How to use
docs.text:
First, select a piece of text in the editor, click the right mouse button, and here are the 4 built-in prefix of the plugin:

  • Optimize
  • Add Test Case
  • Explain
  • Find Bug

After clicking, you will be asked directly.

There is also a Custom Actions at the bottom. After selection, our Custom Prefix will be displayed.

Once selected, you can ask questions directly.

docs.title: Add new prefix
docs.text:
We select Add Custom Action in the pop-up window in the previous step, and a new pop-up window will be displayed.

It is recommended to use shortcut keys

After selecting the text, press the Ctrl + Shift + Q, You can quickly open a list of custom prefixes.

Enter a new prefix in the Prefix field, and the Code Block will display the content you selected by default.

Normally no modification is needed, but if you are reading files of dependent libraries (which are read-only). and would like in its

After basic modification, it may not be very convenient for you to modify directly in the editor when asking questions. In this case,

You can modify it here.

docs.title: Send
docs.text:
After the configuration is complete, click Send to ask questions.

As you can see, it will automatically assemble the data and put Prefix on the first line. Selected Content/Editor Content Displayed from the second line.

docs.title: Send And Save
docs.text: At this step, if you selected the Send And Save button, it will be automatically added to the list of custom prefixes.

docs.title: API Key Settings
docs.text:
This is the latest model officially released by Open AI on March 2: GPT 3.5 Turbo

You only need to configure an API key. For the specific configuration of the API Key, see this article: How to get api Key

docs.title: Model Settings
docs.text:
For GPT 3.5 Turbo, a total of five models are supported.

  • gpt-3.5-turbo （Default Model）
  • gpt-3.5-turbo-0301
  • text-davinci-003
  • text-davinci-002
  • code-davinci-002

You can choose the corresponding model according to your needs.

docs.title: Enable Context Support
docs.text:
Note

This feature is off by default, to use it, please enable contextual support by checking the box here.

More Tokens will be consumed when context support is enabled.

docs.title: Server Settings
docs.text: If you want to use a custom server, please make sure that it is secure and trusted. Otherwise, your API Key and conversation information may be leaked.

docs.title: OpenAI Settings
docs.text:
Click the icon on the tool window. We will do the initial setup of the plugin.

Or Open File - Settings/Preference - Tool - ChatGPT.

docs.title: OpenAI
docs.text: Below we will explain in detail.

docs.title: Read timeout
docs.text:
Indicates the waiting time for reading data from the server. Default: 10s (10000). When the time to read data exceeds the time set below. will disconnect.

Recommend

If the network condition is not good, you can properly set this value larger. For example, set 20s (20000) or even 30s (30000).

docs.title: Connection timeout
docs.text:
Indicates the waiting time for establishing a connection with the server, default: 10 s (10000). If the connection is not established after the set time, the connection will be disconnected.

Recommend

If the network condition is not good, you can properly set this value larger. For example, set 20s (20000) or even 30s (30000).

docs.title: Proxy Settings
docs.text: In some countries and regions, or in special network environments, a proxy may be required for normal use. then you can set your proxy server here. Select the connection method and fill in the server address and port.

docs.title: ToolWindow Settings
docs.text:
Here you can customize the order in which the windows are displayed according to your own habits.

Set whether to enable line break display in the input text box.

docs.title: OpenAI Assistant
docs.text: OpenAI Assistant supports querying account usage information and creating a new API Key.

docs.title: Query usage
docs.text:
Prerequisites

You must first provide an API Key in order to query it.

For example, if you want to query the usage of account A, you have to provide an API Key of account A first, and then you can query the usage of account A.

After you enter it, click the Refresh button on the right side to check it. (Please make sure your network can access OpenAI's server properly)

If no API Key is entered here, the API Key configured in GPT 3.5 Turbo will be read by default.

The query is always about the usage of the account where the API Key is provided.

docs.title: Create API Key
docs.text:
Similarly, the OpenAI Assistant also supports the creation of an API Key.

Prerequisites

As with the query usage above, you still need to provide an API Key first.

After entering it, click the Create API Key button on the right side to create it. (Please make sure your network can access OpenAI's server properly)

If you do not enter an API Key here, the API Key configured in GPT-3.5-Turbo will be read by default.

An API Key will be created for whichever account the provided API Key belongs to.

Note

Currently an account can only create 5 API Keys, if you already have 5, creating them again will prompt an error.

Once created, click Save it above and it will save to the GPT 3.5 Turbo configuration.

That is, it will be saved here.
